name: ESSAI 2026
venue: European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence, Vienna, Austria
description: The European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence 2026 brings together PhD students and young researchers for a week‑long program in Vienna, Austria. It offers introductory and advanced courses across all AI sub‑disciplines, along with specialized tutorials, networking opportunities, and a rich social programme. The school aims to provide a broad view of AI, foster connections between subfields, and create a collaborative environment for participants.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
venue: Skeikampen conference hotel, near Oslo, Norway
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the NLPL network and the OpenEuroLLM project and takes place at the Skeikampen conference hotel north of Oslo, Norway. It targets NLP researchers, especially doctoral candidates from EuroHPC consortium countries, and offers in‑depth technical talks, hands‑on elements, and a walk‑through of EuroHPC experience reports focusing on open‑science and European languages. Participants benefit from a subsidized programme, free registration, and a scenic mountain setting with skiing opportunities and organized bus transfers from Oslo Airport.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: The Probabilistic AI School 2026 will be held in Vilnius, Lithuania. It aims to provide an inclusive educational environment featuring state-of-the-art expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The program welcomes enthusiasts, students, academics, and industry professionals to participate.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England, UK. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a broad range of computer‑vision topics presented by leading researchers from the UK and abroad. The programme includes daily oral talks and provides participants with hands‑on experience and networking opportunities.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
description: OxML Summer 2026 offers a customizable AI learning experience with three specialised tracks taught by world‑renowned experts from frontier AI labs in academia and industry. Participants can choose any combination of tracks to suit their learning goals, with options to attend in Oxford or online. The programme aims to upskill attendees in the latest AI theory and applications.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026 is a six‑day event organized by the Division for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. It brings together doctoral and postdoctoral researchers to discuss topics such as machine learning, computer vision, robotics, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making through keynotes, industry talks and brainstorming sessions. The program includes indoor and outdoor activities at the Happy Tammsvik resort, with full sponsorship covering accommodation, meals and materials, aiming to foster new collaborations and concrete research ideas.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts and algorithms of Machine Learning. It is aimed at undergraduate and graduate students, as well as professionals, and combines theoretical lectures with hands‑on lab sessions conducted in person at the DIBRIS/DIMA building in Genoa. Participants receive university credits and complete a final test consisting of notebook exercises and a report, fostering both practical skills and academic recognition.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, Scotland, UK
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held at the National Robotarium, Heriot‑Watt University in Edinburgh. It offers expert‑led lectures, tutorials, and industry talks covering bioinspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI for robotics, and validation and verification of AI methods, with hands‑on experience using state‑of‑the‑art technology. Targeted at master’s‑level students and industry practitioners, the school provides networking opportunities and a special dinner to foster collaboration across academia and industry.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
venue: Hotel Dei Pini, Porto Conte, Alghero, Italy
description: The 2026 Biometrics International Summer School takes place at Hotel Dei Pini in Porto Conte near Alghero, Sardinia, Italy. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human‑recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis and related disciplines. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers and professionals, offering intensive lectures, keynote talks, and hands‑on sessions for about 70 pre‑selected participants, with scholarships and optional videoconference attendance.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
description: AIces 2026 is the first International School on the Cognitive, Ethical and Societal Dimensions of Artificial Intelligence, held in Porto, Portugal. The four‑day event (30 March–2 April 2026) offers parallel courses, symposia, and open debates for graduate students, post‑doctoral researchers and industry practitioners interested in multidisciplinary AI topics. Participants can attend in person or online, receive recorded lectures for 45 days, and earn a certificate that may be used for ECTS credit.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems brings together researchers and students to explore the interdisciplinary challenges of responsible AI. It offers a program of lectures, hands‑on multidisciplinary training, a poster session, and a social program to foster networking and professional exchange. The event takes place at Umeå University in Sweden from 11 to 13 March 2026.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM'26) will be held at the Escandille in Autrans, France, from 9 to 13 February 2026. It aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech/audio processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through formal courses and informal networking. Set in the scenic Vercors mountains near Grenoble, the programme features talks by top‑level experts and offers opportunities for outdoor activities and relaxed interaction.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
venue: Sandridge Events Centre, Port Melbourne, Australia
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School in Melbourne brings together 50 top PhD students and early‑career researchers for a two‑week intensive program. It covers a broad range of topics from core machine‑learning theory to emerging research beyond large language models, featuring world‑class speakers from academia and industry. The school is held at the Sandridge Events Centre in Port Melbourne, Australia, offering in‑person lectures, tutorials, and networking opportunities.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The 2027 Winter School is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference and will be held at UiT The Arctic University of Norway in Tromsø. It focuses on deep learning techniques, covering recent advances in image classification, object detection, segmentation, time‑series prediction, and speech recognition. The school targets researchers and practitioners who wish to exchange ideas, foster collaborations, and stay up‑to‑date with cutting‑edge developments in the field.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS) is an 11‑day intensive program that offers lectures, labs, and project work on a wide range of AI topics, from fundamentals to cutting‑edge methods. It is aimed at senior undergraduates, graduate students, PhD candidates, faculty members, and industry professionals, bringing together over 500 in‑person participants and thousands of online viewers. The school is held at Swostishree Gurukul in Sanobharyang, Kathmandu, providing a platform for networking and advancing AI research in South Asia.

name: EEML Summer School
venue: Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School, Cetinje, Montenegro
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro from 27 July to 1 August 2026. The program offers lectures and tutorials on modern machine‑learning techniques, featuring speakers and tutorial leads from leading institutions such as Google DeepMind, Mila, and the University of Cambridge. It targets students and researchers in the region and provides networking opportunities with academic and industry partners across Europe.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School offers a focused five‑day program of keynotes, lectures, and practical sessions led by experienced AI experts. It is aimed at doctoral and exceptional master students, as well as academics and practitioners worldwide, with a particular emphasis on the Mediterranean region. The curriculum covers topics such as computer vision, natural language processing, generative and diffusion models, reinforcement learning, and ethics in machine learning, while also providing networking opportunities.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The 2nd edition of the AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI is a five‑day immersive program jointly organized by MoroccoAI, INPT, IMT Nord Europe, and Soft Centre. It offers young researchers, master and Ph.D. students, post‑docs, and professionals a mix of theoretical lectures, hands‑on labs, and project work to master state‑of‑the‑art AI techniques. The event also emphasizes networking and leadership development to build the next generation of AI leaders in Morocco.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 will be held at the campus of NCSR Demokritos in Athens, Greece. The program focuses on natural language processing topics and brings together researchers and students for intensive training and collaboration. It is jointly organized by RC Athena, NCSR Demokritos, Athens University of Economics and Business (Department of Informatics), and Heriot‑Watt University.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques such as GANs, flow‑based models, and self‑supervised learning. It is designed for STEM students with intermediate AI/ML experience who want theoretical understanding and hands‑on experience applied to real‑world domains, and it is offered as a residential or online course. Participants will gain career‑relevant skills and a solid foundation for future research in unsupervised and semi‑supervised learning.

name: AI4Science Summer School
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI brings together researchers, PhD students, and post‑doctoral scholars to explore how artificial intelligence can accelerate scientific research. It covers machine learning for data analysis, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and the integration of AI with physical simulations, featuring hands‑on workshops using Python libraries such as NumPy and PyTorch. The program aims to equip participants with practical AI skills and foster interdisciplinary collaboration to catalyze breakthroughs in scientific discovery.

name: LUT Summer School
description: LUT Summer School is a one‑week intensive programme offering courses that combine sustainability, climate action, marketing, management and inventive thinking across business and technology. It is aimed at bachelor’s and master’s students and includes workshops, classroom teaching, group work and a social programme set in the Finnish summer environment. The school takes place on the Lappeenranta campus of LUT University from 3 to 7 August 2026.
